content:
er 28, 2013
												UPDATE: They have shortened the story and main questline pretty drastically.The game has lost a lot of the original charm and is now almost completely pay to win.Many of the servers can be considered near dead and the game is even more poorly maintained than when I had played a lot in beta to G6. If you do end up trying Mabinogi I would suggest avoiding a lot of the community as they are pretty toxic/dangerous people nowadays. I don't think I would recommend the game unless you're interested in the crafting and social aspect as there are many MMOs that will fufill your needs for anything else a lot better. I recommend FFXIV if you're looking for an anime-esque MMO with good customization and solid combat. ~~~~Old Review:I joined the game originally as a closed beta tester, there was almost nothing to do, but the interesting combat/skill system caught my attention and I continued to play the game. Since then they've added a ton of free content- such as singing, piano playing, dual gunning, farming, commerce, shadow-missions, etc.  There's weeks worth, if not more, of storyline content to play and they're still adding more. The leveling system makes it so you can always play any 'class' you want and have any and all skills or equipment you desire. You do have to rebirth once in a while to reset your level and get the ability points required to level skills efficiently, but fortunately it was made far easier when they somewhat recently added a conveniently free rebirth every time you hit age 21 in-game, which takes 3 real-life weeks after a rebirth to the maximum age. There is also quite a bit to choose from in ways of character customization, and if you don't fancy the anime style there are a few more neutral choices, as well as different races to choose from. You can also edit your characters height, and gain or lose weight and muscles depending on what you eat. There are also tons of clothing and armors to choose from, as well as dyes- although some colors are somewhat difficult to achieve, but there are always fixed-color dyes available from rebirth, gachapons, and other players.  They're currently giving out a free Holiday pet, along with the two free mounts you get for joining the game. Unfortunately a lot of the older pets have been retired and may or may not be re-released, but there are still a decent amount currently available. There's still a lot more to experience in the game, but you should try out the rest for yourself. If you ever need more information about the game you can always go to the mabinogiworld wiki, which although fan-made is pretty in-depth, active, and well-written. All things considered, I do recommend the game despite it's flaws and old age. It's definitely a unique experience and still pretty fun if you can get into it.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 13, 2014
												The easiest way to describe this game would be 2007 runescape, except with an actual (REALLY REALLY FUN) combat system.Mabinogi doesn't suffer from pay2win as much as most MMOs do. There is a "reforge" system, which is the same as maplestory's cube system (use this cash shop only item to give your item random bonuses). But the tools needed for this are tradable, and somewhat cheap in the player market (plus the bonuses are rather low). There's several way to get mounts and AoE stun pets without paying a dime. The only clear cut advantage you can get with real money is rebirthing every week for $10 a week, rather than every 3 (which is probably going to change soon anyway, juding by the updates that the other versions have received).This game's rebirth system means you can play it casually and not fall too far behind those who play it religiously. Someone who plays about 4 hours every 3 weeks will still progress about 25% as fast as the person who grinds to level 200 combat + 30 exploration every rebirth.My one warning to anyone who's trying this game for the first time, or returning, is that the UI is poorly deisgned. It's a mess of buttons, most of which you won't use, as you'll have hotkeys for them memorised. It doesnt' scale well to low resolutions, and will look like an eyesore until you move everything around to where you want it to be. The combat tutorials are also annoyingly long. Once you get past the tutorial and get used to the UI (and outdated graphics), you'll realize how amazing this game can be. I'd personally say this is the best MMO I've ever played.This game also has a very large modding community. Most of which are simple model swaps and sound changes, but there's also ENBs and some clientside script editing.

												I been playing Mabinogi since 2009 and I've been addicted to it ever since. Basically Mabinogi is a fast pace combo loco mmorpg with a knockback system. The combat system is unique and very much loved by everyone in its community. I'd say if you want to try this game, first pick the Alexina server, since it has more newbies than the other servers. Try to make friends as soon as possible you'll need all the help you can get. Picking "Warrior" as your first talent would be wise and a newbie you want all the strength you can get. Confuse was skill to first rank up? Well let me tell you W-I-N-D-M-I-L-L. That's right get windmill and critical hit to rank 1 first, then do whatever. Oh also refine as soon, since its the only skill that favors the RNG in whole game. By the way Mabinogi has horrible RNG percentage... have fun!

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
y 19, 2014
												A free MMO with an anime art style, storyline, and fighting system. There is a lot to this game, but ultimately, it's a game with so much you can become, so much you can collect, so much awesome for you to achieve, but only if you sell your soul to it. Most of the game revolves on making yourself LOOK cool, with special clothing, pointless weapons, micro-transactions from hell, etc. It dangles skills, weapons, armor, trinkets, and whatever neat stuff in front of your face saying "Hey, this stuff exists! And you can get it! But only if you spend 300 hours grinding the same action over and over again!"This game is also very buggy, both for and against you. It can be VERY unforgiving in certain missions, making you start completely over if you fail. The in-game store for micro-transactions has some items that help you quite a bit in surviving, but your spending can quickly add up if you aren't careful.However, if you DO put enough effort into it, you can get a lot of really cool stuff. And I do mean A LOT. They do a good job rewarding you, even though it often feels like you will never make it. Also, the community is surprisingly helpful. There are rarely people that exist just to give you a hard time, and most people will help you if you ask for it. And playing this game with a friend can make for some really fun adventures.I recommend this game to people with a lot of time on their hands, and not an extremely critical way of looking at games. It can be very enjoyable, but it will eat away at your soul if you let it.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
er 12, 2013
												The game plays a lot like Ragnarok Online, which plays a lot like Diablo, which plays a lot like a number of old SSI computer games. Move the mouse, click the enemy, kick its ♥♥♥, and repeat until you die of old age or kill yourself.You can go fishing to raise your dexterity, but it takes about 9,000 years before you can go up a rank in it. The game revolves around training your skills, then spending AP to raise them. The more you do it, the harder and harder (Read: More money you spend) it gets to actually raise it, and it will cost moar AP.With a name like Fantasy Life going for it, you can bet that people do treat it like it is their only life. You can make an ugly female character and buy a maid outfit and learn how to cook and pretend you are an actual anime woman! You can buy an explorers outfit and grind exploration levels (Which reset every time you rebirth, meaning you have to keep doing boring quests over and over again)It's full of incredible amounts of busy-work that you just don't want to do. If you're not leveling, you're probably grinding for materials that go for absurd amounts on the in-game market. NPCs don't give you squat if you sell anything to them, so don't bother. But the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s will turn around and overprice certain items regardless. If not that, you're probably trying to gain proficiency on your weapon. You don't just go to a blacksmith and tell someone to upgrade your weapon, it doesn't work like that. You have to beat up enemies with it and get points on the weapon, THEN you can upgrade it. It costs tons of gold and tons of points just to get one upgrade too, and if you don't do it you will insta-fail.Not only that, you have to worry about the repairing of these said weapons. If you want to try and keep your weapons in tip top shape, you have to shell out so much cash you'll probably end up buying some gold from Chinese Gold Farmers to make ends meet. All blacksmiths except one have a repair rate of 96% or lower. The one with 98% charges unbelievable rates for just one point of repair, the kind of rates that would make even Bill Gates think twice.The monotony doesn't end there. Not only does it take a few years of dedicated game play and credit card swiping to get anywhere in this game, you also have to worry about a broken e-Conomy that overprices ugly clothes that were released on old events because the ♥♥♥♥♥♥s think it's "retro". There are even dyes that have flashing properties, when applied to clothes they flash between colors and give epileptics one hell of a seizure and hurt the eyes of those healthy. People literally ♥♥♥♥♥ out for these in order to act cool among the other trash that plays this game. It's all about getting the prettiest clothes made for youtl;dr, this game is boring.

content:
ry 19
												Dear god, where to begin with this crap fest of a game. First off, it's extremely heavy on your computer. Nexon could have fixed this years ago but they've been busy adding too much new stuff that costs either actual money or about 20m ig gold. I've only played for about two years, but I finally quit a couple days ago. The GMs are very biased and show favoritism towards friends; there's even rumors of the CM giving the rarest sword in the game to a friend of a friend for free. The storyline is decent, g19/g20 were my favorites, but hardly anyone actually plays the game. The game is almost completely dead, and those who still play (at least in Tarlach) just afk all day selling things from gacha for insane prices. Again, only playing on Tarlach, I might be biased, but the community is terrible. There's so much drama between guilds or just a couple people. Half the people, when they actually aren't afk, are total jerks. The other half are cancerous as h e l l. I will admit I've made several of friends on it, I wouldn't even be dating my boyfriend if I hadn't played it, but it's getting worse and worse every month. Save your computer, save your time, save your money, and don't play this game.

content:
ber 3, 2016
												Let me start off by saying I love the anime art-style of this MMORPG, it's adorable. :D Pros:• Cute art style (as mentioned already xD)• Friendly community - I've never met anyone in it that was rude or anything :)• Being able to play musical instruments like the lute, harp, etc. and fight with them :D• Flying mounts \o/• Taming animals• Nice soundtrack ^o^Cons:• Feels a little loney now, like it's community is slowly disappearing or something. :(• You have to spend money to really enjoy the game, otherwise there's very little character customization and pets. They also kind of shove their item mall in your face constantly and it gets annoying x.x• Combat is a bit strange, I don't know what it is about the animations or something but I just don't like it. o.x• As much as I love this game, I played it for a couple months and got bored with it, I rarely pick it up again nowadays. :/ There's just not a lot to do on it anymore, for me anyway. :C This game is a great time killer if you want to distract yourself for a couple weeks or so, but not really a long-term kind of game. u:

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
er 5, 2013
												Pros-Unique Gameplay-Nonlinear Progression-Many different ways to spend one's time in game-Average communityCons-Nexon-Servers tend to be unstable at times. Makes certian skills & skill sets non-viable.-PVP is fun, but has to be balanced by player-made rules. -Many quests & events are incredibly vague. You must use the wiki for this game.-Mainstream quest lines & lore are confusing as heck. -Nexon continues to release more powerful cash shop itmes. You will likely spend at least the same amount of money you would on a subscription-based on them. If you're not a careful spender, possibly more.  -Client-sided lag even on the strongest of machines. Variable (Depends on your personal tastes)-Cell shaded anime-style graphics.-Soundtrack -Nearly infinite progression (Been playing for almost three years and I'm still nowhere near what I want.)-Hilarious additions to the game that make no sense (Lightsabers, Guns, & Scooters in a medival fantasy-style world.)One thing to note is that this game will probably ruin you for other MMOs, if you play it for too long. Point & Click will feel too dull, and anything strictly action based will feel awkward. I really wish there were more games like this, because Nexon & devCat don't seem to know how the heck to balance it.

												Being one of the finest MMORPGs out there, Mabinogi has it all: great combat mechanics that actually require strategy (combined with the myriad of skills to be mastered), a lovely soundtrack, an expansive world with beautiful details, a nice playerbase, along with the fact that it is pretty much the closest you can get to a "fantasy life."I would recommend this game to anybody who enjoys MMORPGs.

Just kidding. So yeah, this is a pretty interesting game with some cool mechanics, which sets it apart from other MMORPG's. I haven't played much, but I got some good first impressions. It isn't too heavy on required specs and should run fine on most PC's. The combat is very different, but execcuted well, in my opinion. number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 24, 2014
												This game brings faith back to the Anime MMO genre. Usually you find games that play themselves by you just clicking a quest (*cough* aura kingdom *cough*) or Anime MMOs that have you picking one class and the skill/armors/weapons are extremely linear (*cough* Luna Online *cough*), However, this one throws all of those out the window. No equipment is "unequippable" save for a few that require tons of training. None are just "better" than the others. The combat system is incredibly well-paced, and even if you chose to be one talent (class), it doesn't stop you from training/having skills from another talent, and that's really what takes the cake for me. As someone who's played for 4 years (without steam, of course), I can say that I'm still finding more and more things all the time and it's never a dull moment. And I will say; this game has the best composing system. If you're good enough, literally 'any' song IN THE WORLD can be in the game. It just takes a bit of work, but so worth it to me, and a huge veriety of intruments to work with too. A definite pick up for those interested in Anime MMOs, but can't find one that's not ♥♥♥♥♥♥.

content:
ry 24, 2014
												This game brings faith back to the Anime MMO genre. Usually you find games that play themselves by you just clicking a quest (*cough* aura kingdom *cough*) or Anime MMOs that have you picking one class and the skill/armors/weapons are extremely linear (*cough* Luna Online *cough*), However, this one throws all of those out the window. No equipment is "unequippable" save for a few that require tons of training. None are just "better" than the others. The combat system is incredibly well-paced, and even if you chose to be one talent (class), it doesn't stop you from training/having skills from another talent, and that's really what takes the cake for me. As someone who's played for 4 years (without steam, of course), I can say that I'm still finding more and more things all the time and it's never a dull moment. And I will say; this game has the best composing system. If you're good enough, literally 'any' song IN THE WORLD can be in the game. It just takes a bit of work, but so worth it to me, and a huge veriety of intruments to work with too. A definite pick up for those interested in Anime MMOs, but can't find one that's not ♥♥♥♥♥♥.

content:
ry 4, 2016
												I've got over 1000 hours on this game (not on Steam, but y'know), so I decided to finally write my review.Well, to start off, Mabinogi is a great game. It's fun, addictive, and anime-styled. It plays well for the most part, save for some server lag in certain areas.The other players are pretty friendly.Mabinogi, in my opinion, is more fun playing with other people rather than on its own all the time.Quests are optional, you're not forced to do them whenever. There's lots of combat skills and then some "life skills" which are non-combat like cooking, blacksmithing, etc.Most events are fun and often give free stuff which is amazing!Not pay-to-win, but pay-to-look-good, I guess is how I'd describe it.The music is pretty great, gets repetitive after a while, though.The pets are cute, too!PVP is optional, so if you don't like it, you can just turn it off!You're not forced into just one class, you can be all of them if you want.Updating skills gets a little difficult if you don't have the AP for it.Aside from that,8/10 is my rating!

content:
er 23, 2016
												This game has changed a lot over the years. It used to be a quaint little game based on Celtic mythology. Now it is an anime based game with everything from dragons to scooters to food trucks. Mabinogi is a great sandbox game if you want to just explore the world, have the freedom to level up any skills you want (unrestricted by a class system) or meet people and be social. The world is bright and cheerful, with a darker main storyline to quest through if you want some direction in the mostly sandbox game. Unfortunately, the game is VERY heavily pay to win. If you want to have good gear, good stats, and be able to participate in high end content, you will have to buy items in the cash shop to increase your character's power. The worst part about this is that the items (gachapon, reforges, etc) are completely RNG based. So you might have to buy just a few to get what you want, or you might spend hundreds of dollars and still not get what you want. Also sold in the cash shop are numerous pets, which help quite a lot in combat. Each of these pets runs about $15, so it can get expesive quite fast. Finally, there are many, many types of boosters that are sold in the cash shop, to help you raise your skills faster and level up faster. These are less of a problem, because it's just a time vs money thing, but it is still the icing on the cake to make this game pay to win.Because of the numerous pay to win elements, I cannot recommend this game, as charming and friendly as it is. If Nexon would just restrict the cash shop items to cosmetics and maybe a few boosters, I would recommend this game in a heartbeat.

content:
y 6, 2013
												Mabinogi is one of my all-time favorite MMORPGs. If you spent countless hours playing RuneScape or Harvest Moon back in the day, you'll probably like this too.Grinding by endlessly fighting monsters isn't necessary in this game, though the dungeons and fields offer the opportunity. Instead, much of your experience will come from quests and skill building. Part-time jobs offered by the shopkeepers of Erinn are a helpful way to gain exp, gold, and crafting supplies. Each character in this world is unique, so doing quests is a good way to build friendships. There is a huge selection of skills, and you are free to build as many as you like. This includes, but is not limited to, fishing, cooking, tailoring, carpentry, metalworking, transformation, alchemy, music playing, swordfighting, archery, and magic. Practicing your trade(s) contributes to your skill level and your overall level. This allows you to use new techniques and recipes.Your character ages at the rate of 1 year for every 1 real-life week. If your level and age get too high for your taste, you can be reborn as your younger self (or a completely new person with a purchasable character card). You keep your skills and items, but resetting your level allows you to try new quests and gain AP faster to promote skill growth. Your character grows and changes weight as you get older and vary your diet and activity, making rebirth all the more refreshing.Overall, Mabinogi is a great MMO because it offers enough variety to last for countless hours of playtime. Even if the cutesy anime style graphics aren't to your taste, Mabinogi is worth a try if you long for a quality crafting/exploration MMO.

content:
5, 2015
												Overall the game can be fun. but has certain flaws. such flaws would be not having the ability to fully use WASD keys to move in fear of getting stuck it's a bit out dated but it's still one of the fun rpg's out there, the community is good, but it can also be bad depending on where you look and your personality. there are very few bugs but they still exist but don't bother me none, however if you don't have "slutwear" you are nothing. at least that's how a majority of the players will see you as. i like the story and i happen to like a lot of the fighting styles and skills. i have spent 5 years of my life and probably in the amount of $5k in NX, i personally hate micro-transactions but for mabi, i can live with it. based on this alone, i will give it a  7/10, now to anyone who actually decides to play the game and finds out about the Royal Alchemist and decide to want to pursue this path, DON'T. you will have to raises 28 alchemy skills to Rank 1 just to even remotely qualify to apply, and even then. training some of these skills will make you CONTEPLATE SUICIDE, i never had a game ever make me think suicide but RA grinding did that to me. RA Grind A/5, Mabi 9/10. COME PLAY, IT'S FUN (i'm not even kidding, i'm still playing right now as i write this review)

ry 22, 2014
												Mabi's one of the few mmo's I keep going back to. Combat is not terribly complicated, but it beats standing in place and spamming abilities on a hotbar. There's also tons of stuff to do outside of combat now, and learning skills is easier than when it was first released in the states. The greatest flaw in this game is the cash shop, as it gives paying players a clear advantage in-game (for example, one can purchase pets/mounts that grant additional inventory space as well as items that reset points spent on skills).

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
2, 2014
												Honestly this game, has changed a lot over the years... Some changes good and some pretty bad... ;;  If you've never tried Mabinogi befor, it's an interesting game to pick up and play with your friends. This game has a lot of story elements, that is tied with plenty of social interaction with other players. Once a huge hit when it was first released to English speaking shores, but now slowly dieing off into history. The graphics are now dated, the engine... Surely, and the players of old have come and gone. The thought of a sequel or a spiritual successor is unknown to me. But if this game was rebooted, then it may have a brighter future. Sure there is Vindictus, aka "Mabinogi Hero's". But it's not a Mabinogi where the cute graphical art style stood supreme and friends were your best and loyal comrades that help you out when you need them most. Not many games of today are focusing on R and R to just sit around a campfire and chat these days and tell stories... Play this game if you're interested, but sure it's not going to compare well with titles of tommorow, but it has some charm. Old and New gamers alike still could say, this was a good game for its time. But now, unless you have a friend on hand... Well. It's not a very good game by itself anymore... It's really getting to the point of extinction.

content:
y 12, 2014
												Mabinogi is definitely one of the most interesting kinds of MMORPG's I've ever played. It's packed with things to do both combat and non combat related. The community is great depending on what server you're on (I'd suggest Alexina if you're a beginner) and is truly one of Nexon's crown jewels in the F2P Market that holds up with new content even after 6 YEARS. The style is friendly, warm and inviting. The music is also calm and relaxing in my oppinion. The skills are a point and click with a skill hot bar system which may turn off some people if they're tired of that kinda thing like I was, but the combat animation looks so cool I barely cared at all plus some skills require you to press buttons like the martial artist talent which I found pretty sweet. However I must explain the cons, The game's Rebirth System maybe confusing to some people. Basically it's the system that replaces traditional "Level Up, Up a few of your skills". Mabinogi has a ranking system with each and every skill and you rank up these skills by spending a certain amount of "AP" which you get by Leveling Up and Doing quests that reward AP. So for those that feel at one point that they need to get more AP they're free to "Rebirth" which means resetting back to Level 1, BUT you keep all of your skill ranks so you're able to increase them further by leveling up. (NOTE: LEVEL UP YOUR WINDMILL SKILL FIRST, IT WILL BE MORE DIFFICULT TO LATER ON) Next on the Con List is the steam version..I've ran into so many problems with the steam version that I just up and decided to un-install everything and re-install it from the actual site. In fact you'll probably get the best performance from just installing it from the website. Last on the con list is Nexon, Now I do love some of their games but I dislike their company mainly for my poor experience in Customer Support. I don't know about you but I expect AT LEAST average to good customer support whenever my money is being put into a company (You can purchase additional content not required by the game in the Nexon Cash Shop for Character Customization, Different mounts, and Pets). Nexon's customer support is poor, so poor that it's almost insulting so buyer beware. So in short, I do recommend this game just not the Steam Version :/

content:
9, 2014
												Still one of my favorite MMOs since childhood. Plenty of content has still been added over the years, probably making getting into it easier for newer scrubs than for older vanilla players like myself. But in this game, you can basically do whatever you want. Don't even have to fight if you don't want to. Just wanna cook? Go take cooking leasons and make dat paypuh. Just wanna make and maintain weapons? Go mine some ore and learn blacksmithing and make your own stuff or stuff for your friends. Just wanna play music? Get an instrument and compose songs or whatever. Just a nice, calming and relaxing game with fun combat. Combat is balanced enough where a Lvl 15 could possible take down a 40 if they play use their skills right. And although Nexon has gotten awfully Jewish over the years, games still ain't Pay2Win. Even with your basic equipment from the beginning shop you could still beat those spoiled emo kids who spent $40 on horses or premiom gear. Overall still a great non-generic MMO with nice combat, land, and overall fun. 10/10 IGN/Sessler approved.

content:
y 31, 2014
												Mabinogi is an intriguing game in some ways, and an extremely frustrating one in others. I'll break it down for simplicity's sake.Pros: - The graphics, while simple, are clean and polished. If you don't have contempt for anime styling, it looks pretty nice.- The sheer variety of potential skills, combat-related and otherwise--it's extremely rare for a game to have its own music system, for example. - The community is fairly friendly and welcoming.- With the rebirth system, leveling is treated completely differently from most MMORPGs. It's still necessary, but more focused.- Combat requires more input than clicking skills on a hotbar. You still do that, but timing matters and knowing the right time to play defensive is key.Cons:- There are very few enemy models, with constant recycled ones given a new coat of paint. This is to be expected in MMOs, but Mabinogi is hit extremely hard by it.- The dungeons are likewise very formulaic, all series of hallways and square/rectangular rooms filled with enemies or incredibly simple puzzles. - While the rebirth system takes some of the pain away from leveling, it still feels somewhat limiting. Initially, with the bonuses of a new character, you can rebirth and start from level one with skill levels intact every real-time day. Once these bonuses wear off, it's once a week. For some, this is fine. For me, it's tedious. -Travel on foot is extremely slow. The game gives you the option of buying pets or using less feature-complete beginner pets to make up for this... Which is great, except it then puts pets on a timer. Once the time runs out, the pets go inactive until the next real-life day. It's needlessly limiting. - While the rebirth system helps, leveling still slows substantially over time during the period between rebirths.Don't get me wrong. I still like Mabinogi, and I still recommend checking it out... But you will know very quickly whether you have the patience for its unusual format.

content:
ry 12, 2014
												This game can be pretty awful, but it can also be amazing. It's really one you just have to try out. High points are that it's very original and adorably quirky. The combat system pulls you in and can be deeply rewarding, but that same combat system will be one of your greatest drawbacks if you don't live near the server. If this is the case, a lot of time will be spent taking hits when your character is waiting for the server to respond to your commands, and in spite of this being an MMO, almost the entire storyline of the game forces you to play alone, which turns way too much play time into a lonely grind through waves of monsters who aren't hindered by server speed. The overt glitchiness is an early sign of how little support the game receives from its managing company, which is easily the root of its issues, but the community is awesome and the game really does play like nothing else out there. Definitely worth a shot. Don't pass it by if you haven't at least put a few hours in, because if it grabs you it grabs hard and you have a great time, but beware that you will deal with a lot of frustrating errors due to lack of support.

content:
ry 15, 2014
 My full review on Mabinogi.I've gotten tired of playing several different MMOs.  But none of them I've played as long as I have played Mabinogi.  It rivals my playtime of minecraft- and I've played alot of minecraft.  Steam can only report about 25% of the hours I've played of it as most of the time, I had launched it through Mabinogi's website Located here.[mabinogi.nexon.net] Mabinogi has gone through a management change within the last few years.  Before it was to the point where one could call it pay to play- as they had a subcription required at the time for priemium storage.  That feature is now open to all players for the next 83 years.  Many of the pet features that Mabinogi had used to be restricted to paying players.  Most pets were around 16 to 35$ USD.  The game itself is still pay to win, as the point of playing the game is to enhance the player's expirence of the game itself.  This game is not fully based on combat (though the Generation Quests say otherwise).If you decide you want this game, it would be highly advisable to get yourself a human character to start with.  With the human character, you can get yourself a free Elf and Giant card.  Without paying further, you wont be able to get other cards.Pets are still pay for- and they do provide a nice benifit aside from looking cute.  Some you can ride, some can also fly.  There are also pets that have a rather large inventory.  There are three current free pets.  Two you get from doing the basic quests (no added inventory) and one you get from the Saga questline.  The game is not a fair free to play.  You can get boosts of every description from the shop, and some of the shop outfits you cannot get via other means.  It is pay to win.Though the free parts are rather nice.Amount spent on this game: 45$

												Mabi's one of the few mmo's I keep going back to. Combat is not terribly complicated, but it beats standing in place and spamming abilities on a hotbar. There's also tons of stuff to do outside of combat now, and learning skills is easier than when it was first released in the states. The greatest flaw in this game is the cash shop, as it gives paying players a clear advantage in-game (for example, one can purchase pets/mounts that grant additional inventory space as well as items that reset points spent on skills).

content:
2, 2014
												Honestly this game, has changed a lot over the years... Some changes good and some pretty bad... ;;  If you've never tried Mabinogi befor, it's an interesting game to pick up and play with your friends. This game has a lot of story elements, that is tied with plenty of social interaction with other players. Once a huge hit when it was first released to English speaking shores, but now slowly dieing off into history. The graphics are now dated, the engine... Surely, and the players of old have come and gone. The thought of a sequel or a spiritual successor is unknown to me. But if this game was rebooted, then it may have a brighter future. Sure there is Vindictus, aka "Mabinogi Hero's". But it's not a Mabinogi where the cute graphical art style stood supreme and friends were your best and loyal comrades that help you out when you need them most. Not many games of today are focusing on R and R to just sit around a campfire and chat these days and tell stories... Play this game if you're interested, but sure it's not going to compare well with titles of tommorow, but it has some charm. Old and New gamers alike still could say, this was a good game for its time. But now, unless you have a friend on hand... Well. It's not a very good game by itself anymore... It's really getting to the point of extinction.

er 19, 2013
												Its the MMORPG that has had me the most entertained and has very unique features, the game sure has quite changed over the 4 years I played it, but its still great, sadly i wish some of its issues and glitches were to be adressed, lag also plays a large problem, but overall, I love the game. Its very social, and its combat system is rather stragetical, but it can even be played to the point its like an action game!, despite of how outdated and glitchy, and all of its other problems it contains, I have yet to see another game to have some of the unique features this one has, its already a decade old as well and its pretty innovative till today.So far, no other mmorpg managed to steal me from this one, as for now, its the best mmorpg out there for me.For 4 yearsEDIT---Its been quite a while since I wrote this review, but im here to update, this game is going to an awful direction, the optimization is getting worse, old content is getting ignored, the game is heavily unbalanced to the point that theres no difficulty, enemies are either too easy, or too cheap, I loved this game a lot and enjoyed it a lot, but then the game just took a bad turn and it seems like it wont turn back from that.The game seems to be far beyond recovery to what is actually fun about it, theres many outdated things about it that devs wont bother to touch to keep the game consistent and up-to-date, and no, im not talking about graphics or any of the new-tech sort of the thing, im talking about how several parts of the game havent been touched for years while more and more content is being added but doesnt mix well with the rest of the game. Its only getting worse in terms of whats balanced, even the story was screwed with so much that none of it makes sense anymore, I wouldnt bother recommending this game to anyone anymore, all what I see left of it is a bunch of people wanting to look pretty in it.

content:
y 25, 2014
												I used to like this game, and I occasionally spent a little money on it. It's one of those games where you have to put in a lot of time to get in any results, but I didn't mind. I had a lot of time to kill. As time passed, it became increasingly clear that this was a pay-to-win, even moreso than in the past. The price of pets was rising to over twenty dollars. That was alright, I could still play. It wasn't as much fun, but I still had the friends I made in the universe of Mabi.After a while, I started to have trouble launching the game - sometimes it would crash after a few minutes. Not long after, it started to do that every time I tried to play. I tried reinstalling it; at this point it quit launching altogether. I submitted a ticket to nexon, which was automatically canceled since it fell under Tech support; the automated message told me to post in the Tech support forums. I was a little irritated, but I did anyways. I had sunk a lot of time into this, so I didn't want to give up so easily. I didn't get any help, just a few useless comments and one or two people saying they had the same problem.I found the game was on steam, and all was well for a time. However, when I helped my Guild mine stones for a castle we'd won in an Auction (it would only be ours temporarily) and we completed it, I found that I needed Premium service to actually enter the dang place. I was less than pleased. I still played a little, just dinking around and talking to my friends now and then, working an undeveloped character I happened to have when I had some time to kill. (I avoided playing it unless I KNEW I had a lot of time; many of the quests require a maddening amount of running back and forth to two NPC's who were often on different ends of the continent, or at least a few cities apart. This game is impossible unless you drop some cash on pets to get around without going insane. Even then, travel takes longer than is fair, and with the increasing size of cities, much of which are empty and with a handful of NPC's spread over something that can take half an hour or more to traverse on foot...) Then, after a while, it started crashing after a few minutes again. At this point, I begrudingly cut my losses, deciding that it wasn't worth the effort and the frustration I was getting from the worsening pay-to-win environment and rising costs.

content:
r 1, 2014
												With my previous experience with this game (and my current play after recent updates), it is hard to say whether or not I actually enjoyed it. What I liked was the customisability and open world feel to the game, with many different play options to explore. However, after my terrible experience with paywalls a few years ago, I subsequently quit playing. Downloading it again to see what improvements had been made.PROS- The game is up to you how to play and explore.- There are many different ways to customise your character.- A devoted fanbase.- Opportunity to waste many hours.CONS- Compatibility and anti-aliasing issues.- It's an old game, so some textures look very low-res, whilst newer items/areas look far more detailed, which breaks the flow of the game, in my opinion.- While the fanbase is devoted, the player base is much smaller than it was, leading to the world feeling barren and empty.- The combat system takes a lot of getting used to, and often made me want to flip the table.- Some story aspects seem forced to add content (race war, really?)- Pop up windows, annoying and always at the worst times.Overall, if you're new, you're a bit late to the party. Has Nexon quality (generally p2p and such). But if you can cope with the cons and somewhat annoying pop up windows, and playing mostly alone, then go for it![this review is my experience and opinion, debate it any way you see fit :)]

content:
7, 2013
												Unlike other Asian MMOs where it is filled with fanbase of big boobs, panty shots, etc. for the male/lesbian taste, and mainly focused on combat. This is a fun MMORPG to try out for at least 3 days (or your money back).When you first start, you may feel overwhelmed and excited to try out as many skills as you can. It is highly recommended that you try out each skill at least a few times before leveling it from Novic to F (if it requires 0 AP then go ahead) because you will not get those back. Eventually you'll figure out which talent you want to invest in, take your time on that.One thing I really like is that the clothing/equipment doesn’t always look the same in color and may not have the same stats either, if created by tailoring and/or blacksmithing, same for some weapons. This game really focuses on teamwork and is very welcoming to casual players as well. Another thing I really enjoy the most is how some of the NPC's break the 4th wall at times, or that some of the enemy's you meet will wear funny disguises. Lastely, weapons and equipment are sort of irrelevant in damage and defense. Talents are what really helps you grow whether be combat or non-combat talents. Level, Age, and Race also play as a factor for stat increase. Can also earn money not only by questing or grinding, but by part-time jobs or commerce as well! If you play your cards right, you could earn 10k+ in no time!There are a few flaws/annoyances though: Can only make one character (Only bright side is that with your first character you can pick all the choices, normal and premium, for customizing, however will have to purchase another character card via cash shop, depending on type price varies, or make an alliance with either Elves or Giants to get a free card of that race). There is no advance warning that you’re using a beginner inventory package till level 30, where you’re able to use the full bank inventory, but the right half will be locked after level 30 and anything stored in there will be stuck unless you get the Inventory Plus Service from the Cash Shop for $8 for 30 days. The inventory on your character may get easily filled if you’re taking on too many talents. When buying a pattern or a blueprint for crafting clothe, weapon, armor, you don’t know what materials will be needed till after you purchase and start to use it. Best to use the wiki for this, it’ll save you up on gold.Recommend doing 2-3 life skill talents that require frequent inventory space like Tailoring, Medicine, and Cooking. It is nice to have at least one combat talent too like Close Combat (aka Warrior), Lance, Magic, etc. Say no more than two combat talents though if you wish to do any non-combat talents, and vise versa.On the server I go to, Alexina, the community is friendly and helpful to newbies (however there are exceptions.) I have rarely seen any players that gloat/brag/show off about their W/L record, about how strong they are, or about their equipment and skills. This makes the game fun and comfortable to play in. Overall, who needs skill when you can have fun? That’s what the game is really emphasizing, fun!The only piece of fanbase you’ll get the best of is at the start after making your first character. Enjoy the bouncy boobs while you can, because that’ll probably be the only time you’ll get to see anything jiggle on a woman!-----Check out more games I see that deserve more attention from my curator group:BluePaw's Underrated Games ListJoin and/or follow if you wish.

content:
7, 2015
												Let me get this straight off the bat: I love Mabinogi. Character customization skill-wise is my top priority when it comes to MMORPGs, but when you start shifting the focus towards vanity items that do absolutely nothing except for making your character look good and you add a crap ton of random classes that confuse the heck out of enemy AI who've only had to deal with melee, bows, and magic, that's when I start frowning on the game. Ignore the playtime Steam has. I've played for quite awhile on the standalone launcher. Anyway, back to the review. In a nutshell, Nexon has turned Mabinogi into a cash grab with no good updates in who knows how long just to satisfy their greed. Yes, I just called Nexon out for being greedy. Yes, I will continue to point out Nexon's flaws through out this review.| Gameplay |The original system for Mabi's combat was a modified rock-paper-scissors match which required skill more than luck. Smash broke through Block, Counter evaded Smash's slow attack, normal melee couldn't break Block, etcetera, but with the addition of new classes and skills along with it, the AI of the mobs just can't cope. They only know the bare essentials with maybe a special skill or two for the bosses.Outside of combat the economy of Mabi is jacked. You can hardly get started nowadays without buying something with real money from the Nexon store. Maybe, just maybe, if you find a experianced player then maybe they'll give you some gear, but with Mabi's playerbase dropping, it would be very rare.| Graphics |Perhaps the greatest point of Mabi is the graphics. But even then they look a tad outdated. Anime/Manga styled characters and mobs is the core concept of Mabi's graphics. Beutiful landscapes and sunsets, dark and grim dungeons, it is pretty cool, but still, it all could use a good polish.| Community |The second most important thing to me is the community of the game. Friendly players willing to help out the newbies, a good rivalry between guilds, the lightest touch of drama here and there... Mabi used to have all this, but with the player base dwindling, well, it's going to be hard to find a person and not a bot. And a reason behind it all is Nexon's inability to respond to support tickets.| Summary |Gameplay   - 3/10Graphics     - 8/10Community - 3/10Average - 4.5/10Mabi was fun. I loved this game entirely. Now it's just a shadow of a shell of its formor(reference) self.

content:
ry 23, 2014
												Ground rules:Don't ever jump into this game without knowing anything. Don't recommend anything aside from a warrior talent for begginers. (Because no one gets other talent tutorials. You can always rebirth later anyway.)Try to figure out a skill build for your current talent.Experienced players are your best firends. (But don't make them your weapons.)Sometimes the wiki is necessary.Got it? Good.Ok, now this game is meant for all of you who are sick and tired of MMOs with the WoW style targeting based combat system. Level grinding also isn't that important. What is important is your skills. Skills make up your stats, what weapons you use, and how you fight. Combat isn't meant to be a stat battle either, (although it certainly can be at times). What is more important is if you know how to use your skills, weapons, and the enemy's AI to your advantage. Overall you have to learn a few things by yourself in this game and not give up if you want to get anywhere.

content:
ber 23, 2014
												Personally, I do not like Mabinogi.  It has a lot of promise buried some where deep within it, but it never really appears.The story you experience in the game consistently has you helping NPCs you'd rather brutally murder.  And the quests tied to these stories have various levels of imbalance, either being way too easy for a long time, or way too cheap all of a sudden causing you to die like crazy.Although the game gives an impression that you can choose what skills you want to learn, what race you want to be, what equipment you want to wear, and what you want to do, you quickly learn that, in order to be good at the game, these choices quickly stop being choices.  Due to Combat Power requirements that only get worse as you level up and learn skills, you practically have to learn the skills in a set manner, with the most gruelling and reviled of these coming first simply because your lower Combat Power makes them "easier".  The races are imbalanced, with Elves being the butt monkeys of the game, Humans not really excelling at any one thing, and Giants being "teh best evarz".  Equipment is heavily restricted by Race and Gender, with the best either being horrendously ugly or costing an in-game fortune because they were once cash-shop items that you can no longer get.  And, as for doing what you want, you have the choice of pretending this is a fancy chatroom like Second Life or you have to do almost everything permanent, including the story, to become skilled at the game.Of course, this game also has problems with lag and latency.  Regardless of how fast your connection is or how good your computer is, you will find yourself getting cheaped on by enemies you should be owning because they have consistent 0 lag and erratic movement while the game's engine is struggling to display certain graphics or send commands at a reasonable rate.  This hinderance continues as you will also occasionally to frequently miss the timing on certain skills, such as the Chain 2 and 3 Fighter skills, because the server starts the timer on them before it even sends the data to your client and you have to go through as series of back-and-forth messages with the client and server to line whatever skill you are trying to do to whatever enemy you are trying to do it on.You might have better luck with the game than I did overall, but I'm just posting how I feel about the game.

												Mabinogi is a game that hates you for liking it.Oh? You're having fun, and are about to fight a cool boss? CRASH.You want to change channels? Silly, silly boy. BLACK SCREEN OF DEATH.Want to use the Steam login? ERROR.Oh! How delightful! You upgraded your computer. STILL LAGS BECAUSE THE ENGINE IS AWFUL. You can play Just Cause 3 and Skyrim at the same time? TOO BAD, THIS ENGINE IS OPTOMIZED FOR WINDOWS 98 COMPUTERS ONLY.Oh? You're enjoying G16? Enjoying Lugh returning and taking over the kingdom, then your character being outcasted by an empire weakened by fear of the very heroes who fought to protect it? All while protecting the future Queen to the throne of Aliech? BROKEN CUTSCENES AND A BUGGY FINAL MISSION THAT KICKS YOU OUT.Do you like stories that make sense and have characters that don't make you want to blow your brains out? Have you been enjoying amazing characters like Morgant, Triona, Elatha, or Antonio? SAGA KILLS OFF GOOD CHARACTERS AND INTRODUCES HORRIBLY WRITTEN, ONE-SIDED ANIMU ARCHETYPES WITH NO REASON TO EXIST.Oh look? A new skillset? Cool! I can't wait to pla-SKILLSET IS OVERPOWERED AND BROKEN - oh, come on! Seriously!? What about this cool rafting minig-CAN'T USE WASD TO MOVE - okay, how about exploratio-WAS UPDATED, COMPLETELY PAY-TO-WIN. ...What about gear? Can I even gear myself u-REFORGES DOMINATE THE MARKET, AND GACHAPONS MAKE CRAFTING USELESS.Stop it! I can't take it anymore, ominous all-caps voice of reason! I'll play another game! I can't do this anymore!-----In other words, this game needs some fixing up and a new engine before it can even be remotely playable for consumers who haven't already drunk the Kool-Aid, or come because of the "anime life" campaign a few summers or so ago.

content:
5, 2015
												Played it from the standalone version when it came out a couple years ago, had a lot of fun. The players were progressing a bit faster than the updates were coming, but everyone was fine with it, we were patient because the game was so solid and entertaining that being patient was the only logical thing to do.I had an archer with a sword. I would shoot my most damaging skill while the mobs were far, knock them down when they got too close, then finished with 1 or 2 well timed sword skills.The storylines were nice, the dungeons were even nicer, especially with friends.The loot/equipment was such a joy to acquire, the hoods, the armor!The classes worked so very good, it really was different from the rest.STOPPED FOR A COUPLE OF YEARSCame back around last summer to immerse myself in it again, hoping to catch a glimpse of what it used to be, maybe play a whole week non-stop during my holiday.NOPEClasses are ruined, system is chaotic, you don't work for what you want anymore, there's just too much stuff in your face distracting you from playing the game, the fighting is nowhere as good as it used to be.There's just no adventure anymore, this game used to be about adventure.

content:
, 2014
												Mabinogi is about as close to Second Life you can get without it actually being Second Life, and that's not a bad thing.The combat is like WoW- a toolbar for skills, click to attack, etc. The gameplay is solid, but quests get repetitive quickly. Clothing is very detailed, and character customization is simple. Overall, Mabinogi is worth the download and is a good time killer for when you don't want to play anything singleplayer or shooty.

content:
er 8, 2012
												While this game offers something new and different than your usual MMO, it is unfortunately crippled by many issues. Nexon is an inept company that always fails to get it right the first time. Nexon's first and foremost concern is taking your money. Anything useful, conveient, and in some cases, necessary you will have to pay for. Nexon's customer service is abysmal; commonly taking them over a year to respond to ticket and even longer to actually resolve it, if that ever manages to happen.Servers regularly crash and/or are under maintenance usually for a long time, especially during or after an update in which they inevitably break something. If they aren't, they're usually lagging, sometimes pretty bad. Hell, initally you need to mod the game just to make it acceptable to play.If you do decide to play this game be prepared for attention ♥♥♥♥♥s, severe weeaboos, 12 year old girls, 13 year old boys, adults that act like 12 year old girls and/or 13 year old boys, meme spewing, and rampant hacking. I say more power to them (hackers). There needs to be people that can remind everyone about how bad Nexon sucks with this game.A good game for people with a whole lot of disposible income ( or stealing mommy and daddy's credit card until they notice $100 vanishing every month) and people who can't play anything better.Some pros for those that think (and will probably continue to do so anyway) that I'm being biased: - Very moddable, pretty much everything, from the sun to the UI to the music can be modded into whatever you can find/make.- A good break-away from your typical mmo; offering things other games could learn from.- Interesting battle system. Although with a past update, took a bad turn imo.- Expansive customization from characters to clothes (be prepared to pay for this too though)Check out the forums.

												I've played Mabinogi since the introduction of G8, almost 8 years ago, more or less. Been a long time though. I don't play as much anymore. The hacking spree that occured several years ago has left the game in shambles and the pieces never get touched unless it effects the Korean servers. Like ♥♥♥♥ing hell, I log in today just to try to do a little fishing for the event, and I come into my homestead to find someone stealing from me, and everything is set to only be used by me but anyone can do anything with it. I'm so sick of everything being broken. I'm so sick of everyone treating me like ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥ everytime I turn around and think everything's gonna be ♥♥♥♥ing hunky dory. This game should have had it's cable pulled in G14. End of story. Go play something else, kids.
